That's a great idea! Creating a digital mood board for each art piece can be a fantastic way to visualize and organize your ideas. By adding images, colors, and textures that evoke the atmosphere you want to capture, you'll be able to get a better sense of the overall mood and tone you want to convey in your art.

Using a tool like Pinterest or Canva can make it easy to create a digital mood board. You can add images from your own photos, or search for inspiration online. You can also add colors and textures to give your mood board more depth and visual interest.

For your Art Walk-inspired piece, you might add images of:

* Vibrant street art and murals
* Colorful market stalls and vendor booths
* Lively crowds and street performers
* Brightly colored buildings and architecture
* Inspirational quotes or lyrics that evoke the energy and creativity of the Art Walk

You could also add colors and textures that reflect the atmosphere of the Art Walk, such as:

* Bright and bold colors like pink, orange, and yellow
* Textures like rough brick, smooth concrete, or vibrant street art
* Patterns like polka dots, stripes, or chevrons

By creating a digital mood board, you'll be able to visualize your ideas and get a better sense of the overall direction you want to take your art piece. You can also use your mood board as a reference point as you work on your art, to ensure that you're staying true to your original vision.

Remember, your mood board is a starting point, and you can always add or remove elements as you see fit. The most important thing is to have fun and experiment with different ideas and inspiration until you find the perfect vibe for your art piece!
